    Laszlo Nemeth

    Front-End Developer

    "There's no failure, only feedback"

I have always been a service-oriented professional with a devotion to excellent customer service. It is no different in programming either. I am passionate about UI design by adding motion to elements and maintaining high discoverability for an enjoyable UX. My intention is to develop user-friendly websites and web applications that are easy to navigate. I like building a responsive environment by using various Front-End Development Technologies and Tools:

  • HTML5

  • CSS3

  • SCSS

  • JavaScript

  • React.js

  • Gulp.js

  • NPM

  • Git

Projects

  • GENERIC HIPSTER COFFEE

    • or

      Check out the coding

    BOOTCAMP HACKATHON

    The challenge was about to design a responsive coffee shop website that contains some basic information, a menu, types of listed coffees, and a reservation form

    Tech Stack: HTML5, SCSS, Gulp.js, Webpack, Git

  • LEGENDARY QUOTES

    • or

      Check out the coding

    BOOTCAMP FINAL PROJECT

    The web application uses an API to generate random and daily inspirational quotes. It delivers five different quote categories, alphabetical filtering of authors, text-keyword searching between quotes, contact form submission to an email address, and mobile-friendly web design with a navigation bar

    Tech Stack: HTML5, SCSS, JavaScript, Gulp.js, Webpack, Git

  • JOKES GENERATOR

    • or

      Check out the coding

    FREELANCING

    A random jokes generator that fetches API data from an URL and gives access to jokes platform. The web application keeps counting the number of reading jokes

    Tech Stack: React.js, Bootstrap 5, NPM, Git

  • WIKI SEARCH ENGINE

    • or

      Check out the coding

    FREELANCING

    Wikipedia search engine using the Wikipedia API that returns the first 5 listed hits and shows the rest on request. The hits forward us to the specific Wikipedia entry, the so-called wiki page

    Tech Stack: React.js, Bootstrap 5, NPM, Git

  • MODEL PORTFOLIO

    • or

      Check out the coding

    FREELANCING

    The web application is designed for a model & artist with a gallery and a blog section. Used third-party NPM packages like react-router-dom and -hash-link for client side routing, react-alice-carousel for sliding images, react-modal-image with zoom option and react-hook-form for form validation. The contact form is set with EmailsJS account for sending messages to a Gmail email address. Mobile-friendly web design

    Tech Stack: React.js, SCSS, NPM, Git

About Me

My first job experience in IT was at Hewlett-Packard in Ireland back in 2015. I worked as a German Technical Support Analyst providing first-line technical support on the full range of products and applications. My mission was, among others, to deliver solution through analytical trouble shooting and problem research. Later, I have spent a few years in taxation analysing and remodelling processing practises, implementing new automated tax services but my passion for IT got me back on track.

I decided to dive into The World of Coding and graduated from a Coding Bootcamp - 12 weeks intense Full-Stack Web Development course - in Prague, Czech Republic in November 2021. I became a well trained Web Developer and then started my first internship as a Front-End Developer in May 2022.

My prior experiences made me detail-oriented and analytical with a practical approach to problem-solving and I am constantly seeking to expand the scope of my coding skills in front-end positions and projects.
